result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Aiken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Alter Price (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).
  • Retail Theft - Alter Price (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with bars, taverns, liquor stores. No contact w/AS and NK.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.
$253 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

timeConds.notes: per week if Def is not engaged w/work/school.

miscConds.notes: $243 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

to amend cash bond to signature bond w/BMP Re-Referral

SIGNATURE BOND SET - RE-REFERRAL TO BMP
 - The court orders a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM). The defendant shall report to DCBM within 24 hours of his release from custody in Portage County.
- If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $300 (per case). BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not be at Target Stores or any resale stores.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.

referral form to bail monitoring

AMENDED CASH BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP
- Cash bail has been set in the amount of $300 per case. The defendant is to be reviewed for eligibility for DCBM. If accepted, the defendant shall be released on a signature bond in the amount of $300.00 per case.  
- If Defendant is not accepted into BMP, the bond will be a $300 Cash Bond.
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not be at Target Stores or any resale stores.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.
